channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Stolen black bin, 14th July
item.description:
Hi there On Monday 14 July our black bin was taken from our front garden and loaded into the back of a van.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Winston Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Fridge freezer, metal object & door dumped in Glendown Road SE2

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glendown Road, Plumstead, London

item.title: Acid etching in stop G shelter on Millennium Way, 14th July
item.description:
Numerous acid etchings on the shelter glazing of bus stop G on Millennium Way. Previously reported via Streetcare under the link below but seemingly marked as "fixed" in error.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Millennium Way, Greenwich Peninsula, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Graffiti / Flyposting on stop or shelter (non-offensive)

item.title: Pedestrian priority phase not working, 14th July
item.description:
The pedestrian priority phase is not happening even when the Wait buttons are pressed. This is very dangerous as the crossing is used by many young and frail people.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eltham High Street, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Resident had taken over council land, 14th July
item.description:
Property abandoned in small (2m x 5m) section of land. Appears a house occupier/owner has added a gate to access this land and a sign that reads "Mama Back Yard Jerk 'n' Spices". This is council land that has been land-grabbed!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brougham Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Scooter EX70 JFF abandoned, 14th July
item.description:
Above vehicle abandoned in front of dropped kerb
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Martin Dene, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish, Noise, Dog barking over night..., 14th July
item.description:
There are squatters on this property. The whole place is filled with rubbish. They bring their cars inside and play loud music. There is a dog in the premises barking over night. The place is filling up with rubbish quickly. Some dodgy business happening.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Martello Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked chute, 14th July
item.description:
Blocked chute at SE1 5QL
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thorburn Square, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Communal bin/ Rubbish, 14th July
item.description:
A black bag of rubbish has been left next to the communal bin over the weekend. This has been ripped open by the foxes and is now all over front the garden and path outside 19&21. Please can this be cleaned up and a notice be placed on the bin stating that the communal bin is for residents only and rubbish must be placed in the bins. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cantwell Road, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement obstruction, 14th July
item.description:
Bushes branches over growing across the pavement causing a dangerous obstruction on the pavement. Possible physical damage to the body a possibility

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Halfway Street, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet
